definitions: assessment or calculation that falls short of the actual value or amount
examples: The budget was an underestimate of actual costs
Their underestimate of time needed caused delays

definitions: student at a college or university working toward their first degree
examples: The undergraduate studied biology for four years
Many undergraduates live in campus dormitories

definitions: area or passage beneath the surface of the ground
secret political or social movement operating outside official channels
examples: The underground tunnel connected two buildings
Miners worked deep in the underground passages
The resistance operated as an underground movement
Underground newspapers spread alternative viewpoints

definitions: dense growth of shrubs and plants beneath the main canopy of a forest
examples: Thick undergrowth made hiking difficult
Animals hide in the undergrowth for protection

definitions: line drawn under text to emphasize importance or draw attention
examples: The underline showed which words were important
She added an underline to highlight the title

definitions: horizontal line symbol used in writing and computer programming to connect words
examples: The file name used an underscore between words
Email addresses often contain an underscore character

definitions: government official who ranks immediately below a secretary in a department
examples: The undersecretary handled daily departmental operations
She served as undersecretary of state for three years

definitions: lower or bottom surface of something that faces downward
examples: The underside of the leaf was pale green
Check the underside of the car for rust

definitions: statement that represents something as smaller or less important than it actually is
examples: Calling the hurricane inconvenient was an understatement
His understatement of the problem surprised everyone

definitions: actor who learns another's role to substitute when needed
examples: The understudy performed when the lead got sick
Every major role has an understudy ready

definitions: person whose business is preparing dead bodies for burial and arranging funerals
examples: The undertaker arranged all funeral details
Local undertakers provide compassionate services

definitions: task or project that requires effort and commitment to complete
examples: Building the bridge was a massive undertaking
The undertaking required years of careful planning

definitions: quiet or subdued quality in speech or underlying feeling in a situation
examples: She spoke in undertones during the ceremony
There was an undertone of sadness in his voice

definitions: strong underwater current flowing away from shore beneath incoming waves
examples: The dangerous undertow pulled swimmers out to sea
Lifeguards warned about the strong undertow

definitions: clothing worn beneath outer clothes next to the skin
examples: She packed clean underwear for the trip
The store sells various styles of underwear

definitions: small trees and bushes growing beneath larger trees in a forest
examples: Dense underwood covered the forest floor
Birds nested in the protective underwood

definitions: part of society engaged in crime and vice
mythological place where spirits of the dead go
examples: Police investigated connections to the underworld
The underworld controlled illegal gambling operations
Greek myths described journeys to the underworld
Hades ruled the underworld in ancient stories

definitions: person or company that evaluates and assumes financial risk for a fee
examples: The underwriter approved the insurance policy
Investment underwriters helped launch the stock offering

definitions: person considered unsuitable or unwelcome in a particular place or situation
examples: The club excluded those they deemed undesirables
Immigration officials turned away undesirables at the border

definitions: cause of someone's ruin or downfall
examples: His pride was his undoing
Greed became the company's undoing

definitions: feeling of anxiety or discomfort about something
examples: A sense of unease filled the room
She couldn't shake her unease about the decision

definitions: people without paid work who are available for employment
examples: The unemployed gathered at the job fair
Government programs assist the unemployed

definitions: state of not knowing or being acquainted with something
examples: Her unfamiliarity with the software caused delays
Unfamiliarity with local customs led to misunderstandings

definitions: process of something developing or being revealed gradually over time
examples: The unfolding of events surprised everyone
We watched the unfolding of the scandal

definitions: mythical creature resembling a horse with a single horn on its forehead
startup company valued at over one billion dollars before going public
examples: The tapestry depicted a white unicorn in a garden
Children love stories about magical unicorns
The tech startup became a unicorn within two years
Investors search for the next unicorn company

definitions: process of making or becoming united into a single entity
examples: The unification of Germany occurred in 1990
Political unification required years of negotiation

definitions: quality or state of being the same in all parts or at all times
examples: The factory ensured uniformity in its products
Military training emphasizes uniformity of appearance

definitions: principles and practices of trade unions and their political influence
examples: Unionism helped improve worker conditions
The rise of unionism changed labor relations

definitions: member or supporter of a trade union or political union
examples: The unionist advocated for better wages
Unionists organized strikes for worker rights

definitions: process of organizing workers into labor unions for collective bargaining
examples: Unionization of the workforce took several years
Management resisted unionization efforts

definitions: simultaneous performance or utterance of action or speech
examples: The choir sang in perfect unison
They responded in unison to the question

definitions: act or process of bringing together separate parts into one whole
examples: The uniting of the two companies created a giant
Uniting diverse groups required skilled leadership

definitions: quality of being true or applicable in all cases and situations
examples: The universality of human rights is widely accepted
Scientists seek universality in natural laws

definitions: state of not being aware of or informed about something
examples: Their unknowing of the danger put them at risk
His unknowing made him an innocent participant

definitions: process of removing goods or cargo from a vehicle or container
examples: The unloading of the ship took all day
Warehouse workers handled the unloading efficiently

definitions: act of exposing the true character or identity of someone or something
examples: The journalist's unmasking of corruption shocked readers
The unmasking of the spy ended his career

definitions: state of not being liked or approved by many people
examples: The policy's unpopularity led to its reversal
His unpopularity grew after the scandal

definitions: quality of being impossible to predict or foresee with certainty
examples: Weather's unpredictability disrupted outdoor plans
The market's unpredictability worried investors

definitions: quality of not being able to be trusted or depended upon
examples: The car's unreliability caused constant problems
His unreliability cost him the promotion

definitions: state of dissatisfaction and disturbance among a group of people
examples: Political unrest spread through the region
Labor unrest led to widespread strikes

definitions: things that are not visible or have not been observed
examples: Forces unseen shaped the outcome
The unseen often influences our decisions

definitions: member of the lowest social group in traditional Indian society
examples: Untouchables faced severe discrimination historically
Reform movements sought to help untouchables

definitions: ceremony or event where something is revealed publicly for the first time
examples: The statue's unveiling attracted hundreds of people
The unveiling of new products generated excitement
